What is there to say?  Portal and Portal 2 are yearly plays at this point. Never gets old.

This will forever be my favourite Valve game. 
The story revolves around Chell and her journey to escape the Aperture Science labs while trying to overcome new and old faces. All characters in the game fit so well in the portal universe and each voice actor brings an amazing and memorable performance to each of their roles. The story itself is pretty good with there being twists and turns and one thing that i must point out is how great the writing is in this game as it manages to balance both a serious and comedic tone throughout the playtime of this game and not once did it hinder at any point. 
The setting of both the old and new Aperture Science labs are quite mesmerizing as the new labs are both clean yet abandoned giving it this dystopian feel while the old labs are portrayed in an older 60's aesthetic making it feel completely separated from the now robot-ran labs. 
Visually, it still holds up pretty well. While there are some textures here and there that may have a dated look to them, the overall appearance of the game is still nice to look at and be engulfed into. 
The sound and audio are so memorable with the soundtrack feeling really industrial, adding to both the mystery and tension that the game has to offer and the audio for the likes of the portal gun, environments moving and objects just fit the game perfectly. 
In terms of gameplay, while i may not be a big fan of puzzles, this is probably my favourite puzzle game. The main thing you will be doing is making portals and solving puzzle which in itself does sound very simple but the way that the developers we able to make these elaborate and fun puzzles makes this simple premise much more enjoyable. The game does add in different mechanics that the player must use to complete a section of the labs which i quite like as it does change up gameplay to keep it from feeling repetitive. I quite like the gel functions in the game with each colour of gel having its own unique use. Finally, the boss fight at the end of the game might feel too easy but i do believe that it was the right way to end the game. 
Another thing i would like to highlight is both the co-op mode for the game and the multiple mods that fans of the game have created as both of these elements are fantastic and offer loads of replay ability in both playing with a friend, a new map that someone in the community has created and (for me at least) the craziest thing i've seen which is the mods that some of the dedicated fanbase have been able to come up with as these themselves are pretty much new games in themselves and it just impresses me that Valve games such as Portal 2 have such a dedicated fanbase that they would go out their way (even to this day) to go and support this game by any means. 
Overall, Portal 2 is a timeless classic with loads to offer and i would recommend it to anyone who has not tried this brilliant game.

The sequel to a simple but enjoyable puzzle game, iterating and improving every aspect of it while adding a well-written narrative filled with jokes & dark humour.

Portal (beide Teile) sollte eigentlich jeder, der sich für einen ernstzunehmenden PC-Spieler hält, gespielt haben. Es ist eine der Kronjuwelen von PC-Gaming. Valve verschenkt dieses Spiel auch bei jedem Sale quasi, für einen Euro kann man dann nicht was falsch machen.

Portal war "Survival Sim" und "Parcours" (keine Angst, selbst als dieser Sache eher ablehnend gegenüberstehende Person macht dieser Aspekt hier einfach nur Spaß), lange bevor diese Sachen populär wurden.

Mag sein daß das Schwesterspiel Half-Life 2 auch exzellent ist, aber Portal hat den Vorteil, daß man selbst auch als Nichtspieler viel Spass damit hat, da es wirklich einem sanft ins Spiel bringt, wo man danach später das Gelernte umsetzen kann.

Dazu kommt noch der trockene Humor, die angenehme passende Musik, die sich auch dynamisch der Situation anpasst und die Geschichte, die einem schnell packt, mit der aufgelockerten Atmosphäre, die geschickt die dunklen Geheimnisse von Aperture Science kaschieren kann.

Einzige Wermutstropfen ist, daß es nicht mehr davon gibt.

Wer das Spiel mit seinem/r Partner/in angehen will, der wird auch mit einem eigenen Spielmodus und Story belohnt, wo man gemeinsam sich durchrätseln kann.

2. Fantastic acting by Ellen McLain (GLaDOS), J.K. Simmons (Cave Johnson) and Stephen Merchant (Wheatley).
3. Each chamber is extremely rewarding to solve.
4. An excellent co-op mode.
5. Great soundtrack.

I'd say this is one of the best sequels, and I daresay games, ever. It's been out for about 9 years now and is still one of the best looking and feeling games ever,.
